title: Hackers have a devastating new target
description: A major gas pipeline. Dozens of government agencies. A Florida city's water supply. And now, one of the world's top meat producers.

title: US tracking Iranian ships that may be headed into the Atlantic and for Venezuela
description: The Pentagon and US intelligence agencies are closely tracking two Iranian ships that Tehran claims are bound for Venezuela.

title: Cybersecurity expert: Defense isn't perfect in this game
description: FireEye's John Hultquist says ransomware is putting companies "in an impossible position" and that the government needs to step-up in order to deal with the threat.

title: Five arrested after 14-year-old girl gang raped in Belgium
description: An investigation into the alleged gang rape of a 14-year-old girl in Ghent, Belgium is underway after five people -- including three minors -- were arrested, according to public prosecutors and local media reports.

title: Britain's royals have denied being a racist family. Archived papers reveal recent racist past
description: It wasn't long ago that Prince Harry and Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, claimed members of the British royal family had made overtly racist comments about the skin color of their first-born child.

title: Analysis: Donald Trump is getting worse
description: The evidence is everywhere.

title: Berman reads Dr. Fauci some of his released emails. Hear his response
description: Dr. Anthony Fauci discusses some of the emails he sent and received near the start of the coronavirus pandemic, including an email from an executive at a company that funded research at the Wuhan Institute of Virology.

title: Michael Phelps reacts to Osaka's withdrawal decision
description: Olympic swimming legend Michael Phelps reacts to tennis star Naomi Osaka's announcement that she will not participate in the French Open.

title: Jacinda Ardern didn't feel like she was 'tough enough' for a career in politics
description: New Zealand Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has said she didn't think she was "tough enough" for a life in politics, in a wide-ranging interview where she also discusses preparing for Covid-19 and how relations with the US have evolved.

title: Watch Andrew Yang get in heated clash at mayoral debate
description: Democratic candidate for New York City mayor Andrew Yang railed against fellow candidate Eric Adams after Adams questioned Yang's commitment to the city.

title: Israeli opposition parties strike coalition deal, paving the way for Netanyahu's exit
description: A coalition of Israeli political parties announced Wednesday night they had agreed ​to a deal to form a new government, paving the way for the exit of Israel's longest serving prime minister, Benjamin Netanyahu.

title: What Fauci's emails reveal -- and what they don't
description: This week, 3,234 pages of emails from Dr. Anthony Fauci, the chief medical adviser to the President, were released through a Freedom Of Information Act request. I'm still trying to digest them all, as I expect many people are.

title: UN sounds alarm over threat posed by emboldened Taliban, still closely tied to al Qaeda
description: An emboldened Taliban poses a severe and expanding threat to the government of Afghanistan, remains close to al Qaeda, and believes it can return to power by force if necessary, according to a United Nations Security Council report released on Wednesday.

title: Avengers Campus at Disney California Adventure Park: Your sneak preview
description: Delayed but not daunted, Spider-Man, Black Panther and other superheroes from Marvel Comics will debut their new land this week -- mere days before California loosens almost all Covid-19 restrictions.

title: US troops accidentally storm olive oil machinery factory
description: The US military has issued an apology after soldiers accidentally stormed a factory in Bulgaria that produces processing machinery for olive oil during a training exercise last month.

title: Fears of oil spill emergency as cargo ship that burnt for 13 days off coast of Sri Lanka is now sinking
description: A stricken container ship that caught fire 13 days ago off the Sri Lankan coast, unleashing one of the worst ecological disasters in the country's history, is now sinking, officials said.

title: These locally elected officials posted or openly supported QAnon conspiracy theories. Here's what happened after they took office
description: A normally orderly school board meeting in this small city began with an unusual warning that there should be no clapping or shouting. But things soon became so contentious that the meeting was brought to a halt for a 10-minute cooling-off period.

title: New York Times reports Trump administration secretly obtained its reporters' phone records
description: The Trump administration's Justice Department secretly seized months of phone records from four New York Times reporters as part of a leak investigation, the newspaper reported Wednesday.

title: Dogecoin surges after Coinbase says some users can trade it
description: Dogecoin is going to the moon again.

title: Prosecutors request 30-year sentence for Derek Chauvin while defense argues for new trial
description: Prosecutors for the state of Minnesota are requesting a 30-year prison sentence for Derek Chauvin, the former officer convicted of the murder of George Floyd, according to a sentencing memo filed Wednesday.

title: Exxon expects third climate activist to be elected to board
description: ExxonMobil said it expects a third activist shareholder will be elected to its board of directors, following a contentious vote.

title: As bombs rain down on Myanmar's hotbeds of rural resistance, tens of thousands flee to the jungle without food or water
description: In a remote part of Myanmar's far west, where narrow roads zigzag through treacherous mountain passes and villages nestle on precipitous slopes and ridges, lives a centuries-old community of hunters.

title: Elephant herd razes 500-kilometer path of destruction after escape from China nature reserve
description: A herd of 15 elephants has wreaked havoc in China, trampling crops and causing more than a million dollars' worth of damage, after the animals escaped from a nature reserve last year.

title: Rep. Mo Brooks is avoiding an insurrection lawsuit. Rep. Eric Swalwell hired a private investigator to find him.
description: Republican Rep. Mo Brooks is avoiding a lawsuit from his Democratic colleague Rep. Eric Swalwell that seeks to hold him accountable for the January 6 Capitol insurrection -- so much so that Swalwell's attorneys hired a private investigator to find him.

title: George P. Bush launches run for Texas attorney general
description: Texas Land Commissioner George P. Bush announced Wednesday night that he's running for attorney general in Texas, setting up a GOP showdown with one of the most high-profile Republican attorneys general in the country, Ken Paxton.

title: Ex-Trump adviser paints disturbing picture of Trump's mindset
description: CNN's Dana Bash reports that a former Trump adviser says the former president is so focused on the lie that the 2020 election was stolen from him that he's listening to "the bottom of the bottom of the crazies in the barrel."

title: 12-year-old and 14-year-old broke into home, found weapons and opened fire on deputies
description: Deputies in Volusia County, Florida, shot a 14-year-old girl on Tuesday night after she and a 12-year-old boy fled a group home, broke into a house, found multiple guns inside and then opened fire on deputies, according to Volusia County Sheriff Mike Chitwood.

title: Grads lose it when university president makes surprise announcement at ceremony
description: Debt? What debt? Graduates celebrated when Wilberforce University announced that student loans are forgiven. CNN's Jeanne Moos reports.

title: Talk of overturning the 2020 election on new social media platforms used by QAnon followers sparks fears of further violence
description: Online conversation among Trump supporters and QAnon followers on new and emerging social media platforms is creating concern on Capitol Hill that President Donald Trump's continued perpetuation of the falsehood that the 2020 election was stolen could soon incite further violence, three congressional sources tell CNN.

title: Trump supporters turn to new platform
description: CNN's Donie O'Sullivan reports on how Trump supporters are turning to a new platform called "Telegram" to push Donald Trump's big lie.
